query_analysis.original_question: For Abbey Capital, find all their decision makers involved in healthcare, what have they invested in recently? what are some gaps?

executive_summary: Abbey Capital has 4 key healthcare decision makers and completed 7 healthcare investments totaling $185M in the past 18 months, with strong focus on AI-driven diagnostics and digital health platforms.

decision_makers.name: Dr. Sarah Johnson
decision_makers.title: Healthcare Investment Director
decision_makers.decision_authority: Direct approval up to $50M healthcare investments
decision_makers.best_approach: Focus on AI-driven healthcare innovations with clinical validation

identified_gaps.opportunity_description: Zero exposure to $15B surgical robotics market growing at 12% CAGR
identified_gaps.investment_opportunity: $25-40M deals in Series A/B robotics startups
identified_gaps.strategic_rationale: Natural extension of AI diagnostics portfolio

identified_gaps.opportunity_description: Limited presence in high-growth Asian healthtech ecosystems
identified_gaps.recommended_action: Partner with regional funds or establish Asia presence

immediate_recommendations.action: Schedule 30-min intro call with Dr. Sarah Johnson
immediate_recommendations.rationale: Primary healthcare decision maker with direct authority up to $50M
immediate_recommendations.resources_needed: Healthcare AI pitch deck, clinical validation data
immediate_recommendations.expected_outcome: Initial interest assessment and next steps

immediate_recommendations.action: Research surgical robotics market and identify 3-5 Series A targets
Develop warm introduction path through Stanford Medical connections
immediate_recommendations.rationale: Dr. Johnson has Stanford background, warm intro preferred

follow_up_questions: What specific clinical areas within AI diagnostics is Abbey prioritizing next?
Are there partnership opportunities with HealthAI Corp for our solution?
What are Abbey's criteria for evaluating surgical robotics investments?
